newsitem.title: USA: U.S. propane stocks show 1.2 million rise in week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. propane stocks show 1.2 million rise in week.

text.p: U.S. propane stocks rose 1.2 million barrels to a total of 50.78 million in the week ending October 18, the Energy Information Administration reported Wednesday.
Stocks, however, were still about 10 percent, or 5.75 million barrels, below year-ago levels. Last October stood at about 56.53 million barrels, said the EIA report.

The main trading hub of the U.S. Gulf Coast showed a 1.3 million barrel build at the expense of a 252,000 loss in the East Coast. The Gulf stood at 21.94 million barrels and the East Coast at 4.98 million.

Last week's unexpected rise in Gulf Coast inventories reflected both the recent surge in imports over the past few weeks and the movement of propane inventories from private to primary storage, said the report.
Midwest inventories stayed largely steady at 22.05 million barrels, 22,000 barrel gain.
Players in the Mont Belvieu, Texas, hub said spot propane prices slid by about 1.50 cents soon after the release of the report.
"They are likely to slide further and then probably come back up some tomorrow," said one Houston trader.
